body.p: News & Analysis: “Siberian meteor spurs dash for data, calls for safeguards” by R. Stone (8 March, p. 1135). The sentence “The Chelyabinsk meteor's death throes emitted the most powerful infrasound waves ever recorded” should have specified “recorded by modern instruments.”
Editors' Choice: “Sound judgment” by G. J. Chin (15 February, p. 739). The image showed Immanuel Kant. The HTML version online has been corrected.

News Focus: “Europe's €2 billion bet on the future” by K. Kupferschmidt (4 January, p. 28). The article says that the gold rush began 30 years after Lewis and Clark's expedition. The gold rush began 42 years later, in 1848. The HTML and PDF versions online have been corrected.

Editors' Choice: “Chick limb regeneration” by B. A. Purnell (7 December 2012, p. 1264). The image credit should be B. Özpolat et al., Dev. Biol. 372, 229 (2012). The HTML and PDF versions online have been corrected.

Perspectives: “Redder than red” by T. P. Sakmar (7 December 2012, p. 1299). The numbers to the right of the image on page 1299 were cut off. The correct numbers, clockwise, should be 570 and 577. The image has been corrected in the HTML and PDF versions online.
